alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 8:12AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ASCENSION, EASTERN WEST FELICIANA, WEST BATON ROUGE, ST. HELENA, EAST CENTRAL POINTE COUPEE, LIVINGSTON, EAST FELICIANA, IBERVILLE AND EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES, SOUTHEASTERN WILKINSON AND SOUTHWESTERN AMITE COUNTIES THROUGH 900 AM CST... At 811 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Norwood to near Gardere. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Gonzales, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Jackson, Clinton, Greensburg, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Addis, Brusly, White Castle, Livingston, French Settlement, Albany, and Slaughter. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 139 and 177. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana; Western Ascension
